title: Projectile motion - range equals height in v graph

content.description: A sphere is launched into the air from level ground, as shown in the figure. The sphere follows the path indicated by the dashed line, reaching a maximum height <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mi>H</mi></math> and eventually landing back on the ground at a distance <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> from where it was launched. The sphere is launched several times at different angles and with different initial speeds. The following graphs of the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-components of the sphere's velocity <math alttext="vector v" overflow="scroll"> <mover> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </math> for different launches.
content.question: In which graph are <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mi>H</mi></math> and <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mi>f</mi> </msub> </math> equal to one another?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of two line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0, 1, and 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Velocity, in meters per second,” and the numbers negative 20 through 20, in increments of 10, are indicated. The first line segment, labeled v sub x, begins on the vertical axis at 10 meters per second, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 2 seconds. The second line segment is labeled v sub y, and also begins on the vertical axis at 10 meters per second. It slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 1 second, and ends at the point representing 2 seconds, comma, negative 10 meters per second.

The figure shows a graph of two line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0, 1, and 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Velocity, in meters per second,” and the numbers negative 20 through 20, in increments of  10, are indicated. The first line segment, labeled v sub x, begins on the vertical axis at 20 meters per second, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 2 seconds. The second line segment is labeled v sub y, and begins on the vertical axis at 10 meters per second. It slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 1 second, and ends at the point representing 2 seconds, comma, negative 10 meters per second.

The figure shows a graph of two line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Velocity, in meters per second,” and the numbers negative 20 through 20, in increments of 10, are indicated. The first line segment, labeled v sub x, begins on the vertical axis at 5 meters per second, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 4 seconds. The second line segment, labeled v sub y, begins on the vertical axis at 20 meters per second. It slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 2 seconds, and ends at the point representing 4 seconds comma negative 20 meters per second.

The second line segment, labeled v sub y, begins on the vertical axis at 20 meters per second. It slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 2 seconds, and ends at the point representing 4 seconds, comma, negative 20 meters per second.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of two line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Velocity, in meters per second,” and the numbers negative 20 through 20, in increments of 10, are indicated. The first line segment, labeled v sub x, begins on the vertical axis at 5 meters per second, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 4 seconds. The second line segment, labeled v sub y, begins on the vertical axis at 20 meters per second. It slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 2 seconds, and ends at the point representing 4 seconds comma negative 20 meters per second.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
